column4: I tried installing ubuntu but i kept getting xserver errors when i did configure it the live cd would load only if i did cd check it would not do the check but it would boot the kernel and i would have to press alt f4 to get live cd to load and when it was loaded it would take forever..so im guessing i have to update ram on that computer it has (256MB) people said it should be fine but i dunno
people told me to use the alternate cd on that computer but i want to keep the windows partition on it..
not sure what the motherboard is
so i should just use alternate cd?
if you are having graphics issues with livecd yes use alternate
yes except installing from alternate isnt as pretty
there isnt a point and click
no no commands it gives you choices just as live does only cant point and click
then thats the prob then the computer needs more ram
that tells you it will run it not that it will run it good
once installed you are fine with 256
yes the livecd has to load everything in memory without swap
